The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Following an investigation by the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs, Great Plains Coca-Cola Bottling Co. agreed to pay $475,000 in back wages and interest to settle allegations of sex discrimination affecting 1,293 female job seekers. OFCCP investigators determined that Great Plains Coca-Cola Bottling unfairly rejected these qualified women for merchandiser, driver, driver trainee, production and warehouse positions at the company's bottling and distribution facility in Oklahoma City.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/newsroom/releases/ofccp/ofccp20140267

Description: Coca-Cola, Nestle and their joint venture Beverage Partnership Worldwide agreed to pay a total of $650,000 to settle multistate litigation alleging that they made questionable claims while marketing a green tea beverage called Enviga. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the amount was split evenly between them.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20100202214248/http:/www.azag.gov/press_releases/feb/2009/Enviga%20Release.pdf
